title: Listview Deeplink - Cold Start (app closed) *[requires TM/TDC tickets]
custom_preconds:
[IDs+Team+IDs+Venue+IDs](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ticketing/pages/3947618/IDs+Team+IDs+Venue+IDs )

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (12 or greater)
AND BP App is NOT open in the background (cold start)
AND the user has BallPark account
AND the user has been given a deeplink


Sample link -- REQUIRES acct to have the ticketed event shown in acct
ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&venueID=32

*eventID is the associated event for the particular ticket [required]
*teamID is the associated home team of the venue [required]
*venueID is the associated venue for the event [optional]

**the exact deeplink will not necessarily work for all accts with tickets
Therefore, you may need to extract the values(teamID/eventID/venueID) specific to the ticketed event on the acct being verified - this can be determined many ways such as:
a) using specific oktaID, extracting from Next-Ticketed-Event context card on firestore doc([example](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/data/~2Fhometab~2F00untlr43sIH7NgMo357?utm_campaign=extensions&utm_medium=SLACK&utm_source=NEW_ISSUE ) )
b) Connecting to a Proxy tool (i.e. CharlesProxy, Proxyman) and triggering the call from BP app
c) via DataDog logs for the users session/trace calls

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has tickets to a TDC event (particular to deeplink)
WHEN user is logged into BP app
AND BP App is NOT open in the background (cold start)
AND user accesses deeplink


sample deeplink -
ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&venueID=32 [teamID=hometeam for this event, venueID=venue for the event(i.e RegSeason or Spring Training), eventID is associated ticket event]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark app is opened up to the Tickets tab 
AND the user is directed to listview of the tickets

teamID=hometeam for the event, eventID is associated ticket event

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user DOES NOT have tickets to a TDC event (particular to deeplink)
WHEN user is logged into BP app
AND BP App is NOT open in the background (cold start)
AND user accesses deeplink

sample deeplink -
ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&venueID=32 [teamID=hometeam for this event, venueID=venue for the event(i.e RegSeason or Spring Training), eventID is associated ticket event]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS] THEN the Ballpark app is opened

[Android] THEN the Ballpark app is opened with a dialog box stating Ticket Details Unavailable

custom_steps_separated.content:

teamID=hometeam for the event, eventID is associated ticket event

title: Listview Forward View - Cold Start (app closed) (optional)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.1.0 or greater)
AND BP App is NOT open in the background (cold start)
AND the user has BallPark account
AND the user has been given a deeplink


Sample link -- REQUIRES acct to have the ticketed event shown in acct
ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&venueID=32&forward=true 

*teamID is the associated home team of the venue [required]
*eventID is the associated event for the particular ticket [required]
*venueID is optional parameter associated venue for the event [optional]
*forward is optional parameter for automatically entering Forward mode with the first (non-parking ticket) forward-able ticket is selected (when “forward=true”) 


**the exact deeplink will not necessarily work for all accts with tickets
Therefore, you may need to extract the values specific to the ticketed event on the acct being verified - this can be determined many ways such as:
a) via DataDog logs for the users session/trace calls,
b) extracting from context card on firestore doc for specific oktaID,
c) Proxy tool such as CharlesProxy, Proxyman
custom_steps: WHEN the user has tickets to the event (particular to deeplink)
custom_expected: THEN the BP app directs user to the listview Forward Ticket mode for the tickets

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has tickets to the event (particular to deeplink)
WHEN user is logged into BP app
AND BP App is NOT open in the background (cold start)
AND user accesses deeplink*

sample deeplink - 
ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&venueID=32&forward=true [teamID=hometeam for this event, venueID=venue for the event(i.e RegSeason or Spring Training), eventID is associated ticket event]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark app is opened up to the Tickets tab 
AND the user is directed to listview of the tickets with forward action sheet open

AND first forward-able ticket selected (if tickets are enabled to forward)
OR 
AND no ticket should be selected and a message shown with reason unable to forward (if tickets are NOT enabled to forward)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has tickets to the event (particular to deeplink)
WHEN user is logged into BP app
AND BP App is NOT open in the background (cold start)
AND user accesses deeplink*

sample deeplink - 
ballpark://listview?eventID=65285&teamID=158&venueID=32&forward=false [teamID=hometeam for this event, venueID=venue for the event(i.e RegSeason or Spring Training), eventID is associated ticket event]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark app is opened up to the Tickets tab 
AND the user is directed to listview of the tickets with forward action sheet NOT open
AND 'Forward Tickets' button shown

REPEAT ABOVE STEPS(1,2) replacing 'dataTier=0' with 
*'dataTier=1'

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN dataTier deeplinks are preconfigured on team page, with different module types (i.e small image icon, carousel images, large button images, list links, etc.)

(QA env - Rockies Team page should have helpful links already setup - 2021)

WHEN user taps on each dataTier element across the different modules
(in QA env - Rockies Team Tab page, scroll down to see data tiers 0-3)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a page is shown with what is passed into the Request Headers

custom_steps_separated.content: for all data tiers:
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND x-mlbam-vid should always show the value of the venueID (Rockies = 19), regardless of dataTier value 

*x-mlbam-vid => Unique venue identifier. Indicates the club and location for which a WebView is launched.

AND x-mlbam-cis should always show the value of the checked-in state (Y/N), regardless of dataTier value 

*x-mlbam-cis => Indicates whether the user is checked into the game.

NOTE: this value is not supported for Auto or TicketScan check-in (as of 10.5.0)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on each dataTier element across the different modules for dataTier 0 through 2
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND x-mlbam-okta should always show the value of the OKTA string for the user, when dataTier value is 0, 1 or 2
AND 'Authorization: Bearer' should NOT be a visible request header, when dataTier value is 0, 1 or 2

*x-mlbam-okta => Unique user identifier, persistent across devices and sessions.
AND x-bp-uid should show the value of the OKTA string for the user, when dataTier value is 0, 1 or 2

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on each dataTier element across the different modules for dataTier 3
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND x-mlbam-okta should NOT show the value of the OKTA string for the user (should NOT be visible), when dataTier value is 3
AND 'Authorization: Bearer' should show a value of encoded value string for the user when dataTier value is 3

*Authorization: Bearer => The Base64 encoded JWT, has OktaID and email among other things
AND x-bp-uid should show the value of the OKTA string for the user, when dataTier value is 3

As a Ballpark user, I want to be able to open a link that takes me directly to an internal page w/ a specified Title

GIVEN a user selects a webview Deeplink 

"ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours&displayTitle=MLB-TOURS-RedSox"
custom_steps:
WHEN a user selects a webview with title passed within the deep link

*displayTitle is an optional field
custom_expected: THEN the user will be prompted to open the deeplink internal to BP app with the value passed shown as the title

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses deeplink: "ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fredsox%2Fballpark%2Ftours&displayTitle=MLB-TOURS-RedSox"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is directed to an internal webview loading the webpage passed as URL, and the displayTitle as the Title
